title: Talks about JD+ at ISI world statistics congress
text:
Two talks around JDemetra+ were given at the 64th ISI World Statistics Congress held in Ottawa, Canada.

JDemetra+ 3.0: a versatile time series analysis software (Anna Smyk and Tanguy, Insee, France)
Efficient nowcasting tools based on mixed-frequency state space models(Jean Palate and Corentin Lemasson, NBB)

You can find the abstracts and the full program on the conference website https://www.isi2023.org/

title: Upcoming Talks about JD+ at NTTS 2023 conference
text:
NTTS 2023 conference will host a Time Series analysis session chaired by Jean Palate (NBB, Belgium) on Thursday 9th at 16:00, with two talks around JDemetra+:

Fixing the model for the seasonal component: a new revision policy, by Maria Novas Filgueira (INE, Spain) and al.
JDemetra+ 3.0: New (R) tools for (high-frequency) time series analysis, by Tanguy Barthelemy and Anna Smyk (Insee, France)

You can browse the complete agenda here

title: Upcoming Talks about JD+ at uRos 2022 conference
text:
The use of JDemetra+ algorithms in R will be highlighted in two talks. Find out more…

R and JDemetra+ 3.0 a new toolbox around seasonal adjustment and time series analysis, by Alain Quartier-la-tente, Insee, France. (Tuesday Dec 6th, 17:00 CET)
Towards Seasonal Adjustment of Infra-Monthly Time Series with JDemetra+ 3.0 and rjd3highfreq R package, by Anna Smyk, Insee, France. (Tuesday Dec 6th, 17:15 CET)

Please find the complete agenda and Zoom link here.

title: New discussion paper
text:
New discussion paper: Towards seasonal adjustment of infra-monthly time series with JDemetra+ by Karsten Webel (BBk) and Anna Smyk (Insee)
JDemetra+ has been recently augmented with algorithms tailored to the specifics of infra-monthly data and accessible through an ecosystem of R packages (rjd3highfreq, rjd3x11plus, rjd3stl). We give a comprehensive overview of the packages’ current developmental stage and illustrate selected capabilities, including code snippets, using daily births in France, hourly electricity consumption in Germany, and weekly initial claims for unemployment insurance in the United States, adjusted with structural models (rjd3sts).
Read the full paper here

title: JDemetra+ New online documentation
text: First release of the new (revamped) JDemetra+ on-line documentation today ! You can explore the new website, featuring, among other things, up-to-date (though partial) information on using JDemetra+ in R and seasonal adjustment of high frequency data. It is far from being complete, but we hope it will grow fast from here ! Feel free to post issues in the corresponding GitHub repository and give us some feedback by commenting this post. (To post comments you have to be connected to GitHub)

title: JDemetra+ New online documentation
text:
JDemetra+ on-line documentation keeps growing. The new website has up-to-date* information on using JDemetra+ in R and seasonal adjustment of high frequency data. Chapters on seasonal adjustment and calendar correction have been significantly improved. It is a work in progress…
*: all information might not be exactly up-to-date as the recent change in package structure is concerned. But should be very soon. (rjd3toolkit, rjd3modelling, rjd3arima, rjd3sa were merged into one rjd3toolkit package)
Feel free to post issues in the corresponding GitHub repository and give us some feedback by commenting this post. (To post comments you have to be connected to GitHub)

title: Release of GUI and Cruncher v 3.0.2
text:
Latest official version of JDemetra+ version can be found at
https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main/releases/tag/v3.0.2
For installing instructions see https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main#installing.
Note that Java 17 is now embedded is in the installation files, you don’t need to tackle this issue on your computer. Be sure to choose the windows specific zip file (if you use windows).

title: Release of GUI and Cruncher v 3.0.1
text:
As recently announced by Jean Palate, the new JD+ 3.0 (graphical interface and cruncher) is available at the following address:
https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main/releases/tag/v3.0.1
For installing instructions see https://github.com/jdemetra/jdplus-main#installing.
Note that Java 17 is now embedded is in the installation files, you don’t need to tackle this issue on your computer. Be sure to choose the windows specific zip file (if you use windows).

title: New version of R packages
text:
New version of RJDemetra and rjd3 packages available
The latest version (0.2.2) of RJDemetra can be found here:
https://github.com/jdemetra/rjdemetra/releases/tag/v0.2.2 and also on CRAN.
The latest version (3.0.0) of all the rjd3 packages can be found at

https://github.com/palatej/rjd3toolkit
https://github.com/palatej/rjd3x13
https://github.com/palatej/rjd3tramoseats

….
It contains a (heavily) updated documentation and (a lot of) bug fixes.

title: Major update in rjd3 packages suite
text:
In January 2023, the following four packages : rjd3toolkit, rjd3modelling, rjd3arima, rjd3sa were merged into one extended rjd3toolkit package.
The available tools are the same, but a significant number of functions were renamed.
The code from the webinar, available here, will work if you kept he older versions or install the older versions as explained on this same page.
An updated version will be available soon, we will keep you posted.
The videos from the webinar are no longer available on GitHub but can be watched on our YouTube Channel
